results.title: Sydney celebration: the opening ceremony 2000 (A)
results.brief_description: At sunset on Friday, September 15 2000, approximately 100,00 spectators (over 4 billion viewers worldwide) and over 12,000 performers celebrated the opening of the 27th Olympiad in Sydney, Australia. Ric Birch, Director of Ceremonies, and David Atkins, the artistic director, produced an epic pageant of Australian culture, from stockmen on horseback to an Aboriginal Corroboree and clan members representing the original Australians, an homage to our sea-loving nature to the modern dance numbers which represented current Australian lifestyles and attitudes. The ceremony concluded with the Olympic torch being borne around the Olympic stadium by a succession of female athletes, acknowledging 100 years of women’s participation in the Olympics, culminating with the Olympic flame being lit by Aboriginal track star Cathy Freeman.

results.title: Sydney at war: the untold story
results.creator_credit: Australian Film Commission, New South Wales Film and Television Office, Bavarian Film Studios, Tamara Popper and Claude Gonzalez
results.brief_description: Intriguing documentary about a midget submarine attack on Sydney Harbour by the Japanese during World War II. On the evening of 1st June 1942, a surprise offensive left twenty-one allied and six Japanese dead. Survivors, witnesses and relatives, from both Australia and Japan, recount their memories of the event and how it still affects their lives today. A moving portrait of a singular incident that brought the realisation that the war was not an event happening overseas - how prepared was Australia for invasion? Using a mixture of archival, contemporary footage and interviews (and with a moving musical score composed by Sam Petty) this poignant documentary recalls in a personal way the lives and losses of those caught up in the perils of war. Written, directed and co-produced by Claude Gonzalez.

results.title: Sydney : manufacturing decentralization
results.brief_description: SUMMARY: Traces the four main phases in the location of manufacturing industry in the city of Sydney. Shows a pattern of deconcentration within the city

results.title: Sydney's Harbour Bridge
results.brief_description: Important historical documentary which records the construction of Sydney’s Harbour Bridge from 1926 when work was first commenced through to its official opening eight year later. Features footage of dignitaries at the Opening Ceremony including the Governor General, NSW Premier (J.D. Lang) but most significantly, De Groot unceremoniously cutting the ribbon and then being taken away.

results.title: Swiss ski symphony = Schweizer ski-symphonie
results.brief_description: Scenes of skiing of all kinds are carefully edited to synchronise with a symphonic piece played by a full orchestra. Photography by Josef Dahinden and music by Jean Daetwyler. No commentary.

results.title: Swiss on white: winter sports at St. Moritz
results.creator_credit: Central Films and Phillip M. Brown
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine style documentary on winter sports at St Moritz, Switzerland. Items include ice skating, ice hockey, horse racing on ice, trick skating, toboganning, skiing, snow marathon and ski jumping.

results.title: Swiss miss
results.creator_credit: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Hal Roach and John G. Blystone
results.brief_description: Comic operetta in which Laurel and Hardy are mousetrap salesmen in Switzerland. They can’t pay their dinner bill and wind up working in the hotel kitchen to pay expenses. Their stay coincides with the local music festival and they have to contend with a gorilla, two opera singers, a St. Bernard dog and moving a piano up a narrow mountain trail. Based on the original story by Jean Negulesco and Charles Rogers.

results.title: Swiss Family Robinson [Extracts]
results.brief_description:
While travelling aboard a 19th Century sailing vessel, the sophisticated Robinson family survive a devastating shipwreck and are forced to carve out a daring, primitive new life for themselves on a dangerous, deserted tropical island. Cast includes Dorothy McGuire, James MacArthur.
Extracts taken from the Walt Disney 1960 feature film production.

results.title: Swinging the broom
results.creator_credit: Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School, Andrew Wiseman and Geoffrey Hall
results.brief_description: An elderly street sweeper, who has grown tired of his supposedly nagging wife, seeks relief from her by meeting the young woman he sees on his cleaning round. Ending up badly beaten, after his intentions have been misunderstood by one of the women, he arrives home to discover a caring wife. They make up and his misguided ways appear over. But are they?

results.title: Swing Fitness for Older Adults
results.brief_description: This gentle, all new, swing movement video is designed specifically for the young at heart (30-80 years) who wish to keep supple, healthy and full of life with a minimum of effort and a maximum amount of enjoyment. If you are ready to begin exercising in the safest way possible, you are ready for this remarkable program.
